conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C, analyze the process using thermodynamic principles.
The process from state B to state C is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The pressure at state B and state C is 0.6p0.
The volume at state B is 0.5V0 and at state C is V0.
The change in volume ΔV is V0 - 0.5V0 = 0.5V0.
For an isobaric process, the work done W by the gas is W = P ΔV.
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is 0.3p0V0.
